question: NBA: Who will win Nets vs. Celtics, scheduled for April 25, 7:01 PM ET?
description:

events.title: 2022 NBA Playoffs: April 25th
events.description:
The 2021–22 NBA season is the 76th season of the National Basketball Association (NBA), a professional basketball league in North America. 

The league is composed of 30 teams (29 in the United States and 1 in Canada) and is one of the four major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. It is the premier men's professional basketball league in the world.

The playoffs of the 2021-22 NBA season will begin on April 16 and will end at the conclusion of the 2022 NBA Finals. The playoffs follow a tournament format in a best-of-seven series.

question: Will the AAA US average national gas price drop below $4.00 by May 10, 2022?
description:
This market asks whether the average US regular gas price according to the American Automotive Association (AAA) will fall below $4.000 by May 10, 2022.

If the average US regular gas price according to AAA is $3.999 or lower (i.e. less than $4.000) on any day between the date of this market's inception April 25 and May 10, 2022 (inclusive) this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be information from the American Automotive Association (AAA), presently found here: https://gasprices.aaa.com/. Specifically, the cell under "Regular" and for the row "Current Avg." will be checked at 8 PM ET daily. If the URL for gas prices as determined by AAA changes, the resolution URL will change. If the resolution source is unavailable on the resolution date, May 10, 2022, 8 PM ET, the source will be checked 24 hours later, specifically "Yesterday Avg.", and if still unavailable, another credible source will be used such as https://www.gasbuddy.com/.

question: Will a barrel of crude oil close at $100 or more on May 4, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether the price of crude oil will be at $100.00 USD or higher as of market close on the resolution date, May 4, 2022. If the price of a barrel of crude oil is $100.00 or greater as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “Yes”. If the value of a barrel of oil is less than $100.00 as of market close on the resolution date, this market will resolve as “No”.

The resolution source for this market will be Yahoo Finance’s reporting of the values offered by the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX), found at (https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/CL%3DF/history). The resolution will be based on the value listed in the column labelled “Close*” under the resolution date. If the resolution source is deemed unreliable, other credible media sources may be used.

question: Will Jada or Will Smith announce they're getting divorced by September 1, 2022?
description:
In recent years revelations of infidelity between Jada Pinkett Smith and Will Smith came to light in a string of television interviews. Videos of strange home interactions between the couple have made their rounds on the Internet, and Will Smith slapped Chris Rock after the famous comedian made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's alopecia. These episodes lead many to speculate there could be irreconcilable differences between the Smiths.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Jada Pinkett Smith and/or Willard Carroll Smith II announce that they are getting a divorce by September 1, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, an announcement by either Jada Pinkett Smith, Will Smith, or both, will be sufficient for a "Yes" resolution, regardless of whether the divorce later actually occurs, or whether the actual divorce occurs outside of the timeframe of this market.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official announcements by Jada Pinkett Smith and/or Will Smith (these may be made via social media, e.g. https://twitter.com/jadapsmith, https://www.instagram.com/willsmith/, etc), or statements made on their behalf by their official and/or legal representatives. However, credible reporting from other sources of either of them saying they will get divorced may be used (i.e. Will Smith shouts in a restaurant that he is divorcing Jada Pinkett Smith and footage of the encounter is leaked).
